snippet: Costa Rica will play the Netherlands on Saturday, and a victory could bring a sense of solidarity to a region where the country’s team had been in the shadow of Mexico and the United States.
abstract: Author Andreas Campomar essay holds that underdog Costa Rica faces formidable Netherlands team in World Cup quarterfinals, but victory could bring a sense of solidarity to a region where the Costa Rican team has been in the shadow of Mexico and the United States.
lead_paragraph: Costa Rica will play the Netherlands on Saturday, and a victory could bring a sense of solidarity to a region where the country’s team had been in the shadow of Mexico and the United States.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Costa Rica Could Learn From Uruguay's Example
headline.main: The Hopes of Central America Rest on a Perpetual Underdog
headline.print_headline: The Hopes of Central America Rest on a Perpetual Underdog
